intro: Littledalea przevalskyi, commonly known as the Przhevalsky's little dalea, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. It has a compact growth habit with trifoliate leaves and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
